# norman

[![Build
Status](https://travis-ci.org/DavidFirth/norman.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/DavidFirth/norman)

Special-purpose software for Warwick Statistics internal reports on
module marks

This is open source software, but unlikely to be of interest to anyone
not involved in the administration of the Department of Statistics at
the University of Warwick.

> \[!NOTE\] The original version of norman was developed by David Firth.
> With his retirement, and on his suggestion, the
> Warwick-Stats-Resources organisation has forked his repository and all
> further development of the package will happen here.

## Instructions

**norman** is an *R* package, and there is a short document (a
*vignette* in *R*) that gives instructions on how to install it and use
it. The vignette can either be viewed in *R* (once the package has been
installed!), or directly on the web at
<https://davidfirth.github.io/norman/articles/instructions.html>

## Why “norman”?

Because I needed a memorable name for this package. And because *nobody*
was ever better at marking:
<https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Norman_Hunter_(footballer)>

# Package index

## All functions

- [`check_modules_expected()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/check_modules_expected.md)
  : Check the marks folder contents against file
  "modules_expected_here.txt"

- [`get_module_effects()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/get_module_effects.md)
  : Print and return a table of module effects

- [`list_all_median_differences()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/list_all_median_differences.md)
  : List all median within-student differences between modules

- [`make_module_pages()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/make_module_pages.md)
  : Make a report page for each module

- [`meddiff()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/meddiff.md)
  : Compute a matrix of median differences

- [`meddiff_fit()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/meddiff_fit.md)
  : Extract module effects from the median differences

- [`meddiff_for_display()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/meddiff_for_display.md)
  :

  A version of `meddiff` to compute median differences in a different
  format

- [`print_file_listing()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/print_file_listing.md)
  : Print and return the list of files in a folder

- [`print_module_effect()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/print_module_effect.md)
  : Get the module effect for a given module code

- [`print_path()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/print_path.md)
  : Get the full path of a folder

- [`raw_mark_classes()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/raw_mark_classes.md)
  : Make a matrix of percentages in each degree class range, for all
  modules

- [`raw_mark_summaries()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/raw_mark_summaries.md)
  : Make a matrix of 7-number summaries for all modules

- [`save_history()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/save_history.md)
  : Save history

- [`scatter()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/scatter.md)
  : Make a module-specific scatterplot

- [`stemleaf()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/stemleaf.md)
  : Make a module-specific stem and leaf plot

- [`update()`](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/reference/update.md)
  :

  Update the `norman` package — a wrapper for
  [`remotes::install_github`](https://remotes.r-lib.org/reference/install_github.html)

# Articles

### All vignettes

- [Making a Report on a Set of Module
  Marks](https://warwick-stats-resources.github.io/norman/articles/instructions.md):
